page.title: 15Houghton-Historic Buildings
page.content: There are many interesting & historic buildings in Houghton. St.MIchaels church was built in the 13th.Century although restorations which took place in the 1830's changed it's appearence. There is also the Kepier Grammer School which was founded by Bernard Gilpin,Sometimes referred to as the apostle of the North,in 1574 the Davenport almshouses were built in 1668,while the old rectory was built in the 15th.Century is now the council Offices.The Elizabethan Houghton Hall is described as one of the more perfect specimens of the "plain style" of arcitecture & was so powerfully built that it has required little repair or alteration.In Nesham Place and Church street can be seen some fine examples of 18th.Century town houses.
